signals.context: 3 of 3 awards (100.0%) to FAMILY ENDEAVORS, INC. were non-competitive. Non-competed amount: $2,013,664,365.4 (100.0% of total).

metadata.name: Single-Bid Competition
metadata.description: Flags competitively-solicited contracts that received only one bid
metadata.methodology: Counts competitively-solicited contracts where number_of_offers_received = 1. Based on OCP Red Flags Guide and EU Single Market Scoreboard methodology.

metadata.name: Non-Competitive Awards
metadata.description: Flags awards made without open competition (sole-source, non-competed)
metadata.methodology: Identifies awards with extent_competed codes indicating no open competition (B=Not Available, C=Not Competed, G=Not Competed Under SAP, NDO=Non-Competitive Delivery Order). Based on OECD Guidelines and Fazekas & Kocsis corruption risk methodology.

metadata.name: Contract Value Splitting
metadata.description: Detects clusters of awards just below regulatory thresholds
metadata.methodology: Groups awards by (agency, recipient, period) and counts those falling within 10% below regulatory thresholds ($250,000, $7,500,000). Clusters of 3+ awards in the band suggest deliberate splitting.

metadata.name: Vendor Concentration
metadata.description: Flags when a single supplier dominates an agency's spending
metadata.methodology: Computes each vendor's share of contract spend at agency, sub-agency, and NAICS sector levels. Flags vendors with >30% share. Based on EU Single Market Scoreboard concentration benchmarks.

metadata.name: Excessive Modifications
metadata.description: Flags contracts with too many modifications or excessive cost growth
metadata.methodology: Counts substantive modifications (excluding $0 admin changes) per contract. Flags contracts with >5 modifications or cost growth >100%. Based on OECD procurement integrity guidelines.

metadata.name: Price Outliers
metadata.description: Flags awards with abnormally high amounts vs same-category peers
metadata.methodology: Groups awards by NAICS/PSC code, computes Q1/Q3/IQR, flags amounts above Q3 + 1.5*IQR. Inspired by Cardinal-rs quartile-based thresholding.
